Title: Lapse, the app turning your phone into an old-school camera, snaps up $30M
Text:
Lapse: A Nostalgic Twist on Modern Photography

In the era of digital photography, where instant gratification and endless editing options reign supreme, a new app called Lapse is taking us back to the simpler days of analog cameras. With Lapse, you can experience the charm and anticipation of waiting for your photos to "develop" before sharing them with a select group of friends.

A Growing Phenomenon

Since its launch, Lapse has gained significant traction, boasting millions of users, 100 million photos captured monthly, and a consistent top-10 ranking in the U.S. app store for photography apps. This recent $30 million funding round, led by Greylock and DST Global Partners, will fuel Lapse's ambitious plans for the future.

Behind the Scenes Magic

Lapse is more than just a retro-inspired app; it employs a sophisticated blend of technology and artistry to enhance your photos. Each image undergoes a 12-step processing journey, involving computer vision, in-house algorithms, and third-party technology. This meticulous treatment ensures that your photos look their best, optimizing subjects and composition.

The Allure of Simplicity

In a world saturated with social media platforms vying for our attention, Lapse offers a refreshing alternative. It eschews advertising and focuses on the core essence of photography: capturing and sharing moments with loved ones. This simplicity has resonated with users, particularly those yearning for a more authentic and intimate social experience.

Growth and Challenges

Lapse's initial growth strategy involved using growth-hacking techniques and forced invites. While this tactic helped boost downloads, it also raised concerns about sustainability and user experience. The company has since shifted its focus to organic growth, relying on the app's unique features and word-of-mouth recommendations.

A Gap in the Market

The rise of Lapse highlights a growing demand for simpler, more private social media platforms. Consumers are increasingly wary of the data they share and the impact of social media on their well-being. Lapse taps into this desire for a more authentic and controlled online experience.

The Future of Lapse

Lapse's latest funding round will enable it to expand its features, explore video capabilities, and potentially introduce monetization strategies that align with its ethos. The company aims to create a thriving community where users can connect with friends, share their lives, and cherish the moments that matter.

A New Era of Social Media

Lapse represents a shift in the social media landscape, offering a refreshing alternative to the dominant platforms. Its focus on simplicity, privacy, and authentic connections resonates with users seeking a more meaningful online experience. As Lapse continues to evolve, it will be exciting to see how it shapes the future of social media.

Title: Lapse, the app turning your phone into an old-school camera, snaps up $30M
Text:
The Nostalgia of Analogue Photography, Reimagined for the Digital Age

In the era of digital photography, the charm of analogue cameras has faded into obscurity. The cost and hassle of film, batteries, and development have made it an expensive and impractical pursuit. But what if you could experience the nostalgia of analogue photography without the hefty price tag?

Enter Lapse, a smartphone app that brings the essence of analogue photography to the digital realm. With Lapse, you can take photos that you can't see until they're "developed," mimicking the anticipation and excitement of waiting for your film to be processed.

A Growing Phenomenon

Since its launch, Lapse has gained immense popularity, boasting millions of users and a consistent top-10 ranking in the U.S. app store. This success has attracted the attention of investors, who have recently poured $30 million into the company to fuel its growth.

Behind-the-Scenes Magic

While Lapse emulates the analogue experience, it also incorporates technological advancements to enhance your photos. The app employs computer vision and other techniques to analyze your images, optimizing the composition and making your subjects look their best.

A Different Path to Monetization

Unlike many social media apps that rely on advertising, Lapse is exploring alternative revenue streams. CEO Dan Silvertown believes that the company can avoid the pitfalls of excessive advertising by focusing on providing a unique and valuable experience to its users.

Ethical Concerns and Growth Strategies

Lapse has faced scrutiny for its initial use of growth-hacking tactics, such as forced invites. However, the company has since shifted its approach, recognizing the importance of user trust and organic growth.

A Niche in the Social Media Landscape

In a world saturated with social media giants, Lapse offers a refreshing alternative. It focuses on sharing with small groups of friends, providing a private and intimate space to connect.

The Future of Lapse

Lapse is poised to expand its offerings, with plans for enhanced photo editing features and a potential foray into video. The company's investors believe that there's a growing demand for simpler, more authentic social media experiences, and Lapse is well-positioned to fill that void.

Lapse is a testament to the enduring appeal of analogue photography. By combining the nostalgia of the past with the convenience of the present, it offers a unique and engaging way to capture and share life's moments with those you care about.

Title: SynFlora is working on bioengineering a skincare revolution
Text:
In the bustling halls of 4YFN at the MWC tradeshow in Barcelona, a Spanish biotech startup called SynFlora unveiled a groundbreaking concept for skin treatment technology. Led by three PhD-holding co-founders, SynFlora aims to revolutionize skincare by harnessing the power of skin microbes.

Their vision is to go beyond the limitations of topical creams and develop targeted, novel therapeutics by engineering skin microbes. This approach promises deeper treatment penetration than traditional skincare products, enabling a wider range of applications.

"We're creating a new foundation for skin products, not just molecules that can't penetrate the skin," explains co-founder and CEO Nastassia Knōdlseder. "It's like a molecular machine, a bacteria that can travel deep into the hair follicles and produce new effects."

SynFlora's initial focus is on acne, and they've already published a study in Nature Biotechnology demonstrating the effectiveness of their experimental treatment delivery approach in mice. However, they envision a much broader range of applications, including mosquito repellents, fat loss treatments, vaccines, and anti-inflammatory therapies.

"We can potentially trigger the immune system or create vaccines against melanoma," Knōdlseder explains. "We can also produce anti-inflammatory molecules."

SynFlora's platform technology has the potential to transform skincare and beyond. With patents for various indications and the platform itself, the startup is poised to make a significant impact.

Currently, SynFlora is in the early stages of development and is seeking funding through a seed round. They anticipate that their novel system could power a new generation of skin-delivered therapeutics within one to three years, pending regulatory approval.

SynFlora's innovative approach to skincare is a testament to the power of biotechnology in unlocking new possibilities for health and wellness. Their work holds the promise of revolutionizing the way we treat and prevent a wide range of skin conditions and beyond.

Title: Splitscreen brings a multi-monitor setup to Apple's Vision Pro
Text:
Unveiling Splitscreen: A Revolutionary App for Apple's Vision Pro

Apple's Vision Pro, a remarkable device that blends the worlds of virtual and augmented reality, has captured the imagination of tech enthusiasts worldwide. Now, a groundbreaking app called Splitscreen takes the Vision Pro experience to new heights, allowing users to seamlessly integrate a second macOS display into their VR/AR environment.

A Multitasking Masterpiece:

Splitscreen empowers multitaskers to harness the power of multiple Mac computers with their Vision Pro. Whether you're a creative professional juggling multiple projects or a multitasking guru seeking an immersive workspace, Splitscreen delivers an unparalleled experience. Imagine the convenience of having separate displays for work and personal use, all within the immersive environment of the Vision Pro.

Overcoming Technical Hurdles:

Creating Splitscreen was no easy feat, as developer Jordi Bruin acknowledges. The app's innovative approach, however, paves the way for future enhancements, including more displays, customizable settings, and improved stability. Bruin assures users that these features are in the pipeline, promising an even more immersive and versatile experience.

The Creative Minds Behind Splitscreen:

The Splitscreen app is the brainchild of a talented team of indie developers: Mathijs Kadjik, Tom Lokhorst, and Jordi Bruin. These innovators have a proven track record of creating groundbreaking apps, including the iPhone-to-Mac mirroring app Bezel, a suite of utilities for iOS, and health apps like Soosee and PosturePal. Their expertise shines through in Splitscreen, delivering a seamless and intuitive experience.

Exploring Splitscreen's Features:

Upon launch, Splitscreen automatically connects to the Vision Pro via the optimal network available. Recognizing that performance can vary, the developers offer a generous 15-minute free session to test the app on your network. This session can be reset after each use, or users can unlock unlimited access with a one-time in-app purchase of $20 (until the end of March).

Currently, Splitscreen supports a single resolution (1920×1080), but the developers are actively working on expanding resolution options and enabling support for more than two displays. The app is compatible with Apple Silicon Macs, utilizing the HEVC video codec for efficient video data transfer. Support for Intel Macs will be added in a future update.

A Free Download Awaits:

Head over to the App Store to download Splitscreen absolutely free. Embark on a journey of multitasking like never before, unlocking the full potential of your Vision Pro and transforming your workspace into an immersive and productive haven.

Title: GitHub's Copilot Enterprise is now generally available at $39 a month
Text:
Copilot Enterprise: Empowering Developers with Enhanced Collaboration and Code Completion

In a significant move, GitHub has unveiled Copilot Enterprise, a revamped version of its popular code completion tool and developer-centric chatbot, tailored specifically for large organizations. This premium offering, priced at $39 per month, expands upon the features of the existing Business plan, providing crucial enhancements for larger teams.

Key Features of Copilot Enterprise

1. Internal Code and Knowledge Base Integration:
   - Copilot Enterprise seamlessly integrates with an organization's internal code and knowledge base, enabling developers to access and leverage their organization-specific processes, libraries, and tools.

2. Microsoft Bing Integration (Beta):
   - Copilot now harnesses the power of Microsoft's Bing search engine, allowing developers to stay updated on the latest changes in open source libraries and APIs.

3. Fine-Tuning Based on Team's Codebase:
   - Soon, teams can fine-tune Copilot's models using their existing codebase, resulting in optimized suggestions tailored to their specific coding practices.

Benefits for Developers

1. Enhanced Productivity:
   - Copilot Enterprise streamlines development workflows, enabling developers to quickly deploy container images to the cloud and navigate internal processes efficiently.

2. Improved Knowledge Transfer:
   - New team members can swiftly grasp organization-specific processes, reducing onboarding time and fostering knowledge sharing.

3. Exploration Beyond Engineering:
   - Copilot's capabilities extend beyond code, enabling developers to explore non-engineering topics such as vacation policies and internal resources.

Future of Copilot

GitHub CEO Thomas Dohmke envisions a future where Copilot becomes an integral part of the developer workflow, seamlessly integrated into the tools and platforms developers already use. This vision aligns with GitHub's commitment to providing an end-to-end experience that empowers developers to build the world's software.

Underlying Technology

Copilot Enterprise leverages GPT 3.5 Turbo, a powerful language model renowned for its code completion capabilities. GitHub's focus on latency requirements has precluded a transition to GPT 4, but the team has continuously updated the model, ensuring optimal performance.

Pricing Strategy

Unlike Google's approach, GitHub's pricing strategy for Copilot Enterprise is not based on model size. Instead, the company emphasizes the importance of selecting the most suitable model for each use case, prioritizing factors such as latency, accuracy, and responsible AI.

Title: MWC 2024: Everything announced so far, including a 'rollable' Motorola concept phone
Text:
Mobile World Congress 2024: A Glimpse into the Future of Tech

From the bustling streets of Barcelona, the TechCrunch team brings you the latest buzz from Mobile World Congress 2024. Get ready for a whirlwind tour of groundbreaking products, exciting announcements, and innovative startups shaping the future of technology.

Displace: Transforming TV Viewing

Displace, a company pushing the boundaries of home entertainment, unveiled its revolutionary 55-inch Display Flex. This "wireless" 4K OLED TV defies traditional mounting methods, adhering to walls with ease. With a price tag of $3,000, it's a statement piece that blends seamlessly into any living space.

Motorola's Visionary Rollable Phone Concept

Motorola, known for its innovative designs, showcased a captivating concept: a rollable phone that wraps around your wrist. While still in its conceptual stage, this device sparks imagination and hints at the future of wearable technology.

Doublepoint's Gesture-Touch Control for Android Smartwatches

Android smartwatch users rejoice! Doublepoint's WowMouse gesture-touch control app now graces your wrists. Pinch, swipe, and navigate with ease, unlocking a new dimension of control and convenience.

Microsoft's AI Access Principles: A Framework for Responsible AI

Brad Smith, Microsoft's president and vice chair, introduced the "AI Access Principles," an 11-point plan guiding the company's approach to AI datacenter infrastructure and other critical AI assets worldwide. This framework emphasizes openness to dialogue and collaboration, fostering responsible and ethical AI development.

Xiaomi's Electric Vehicle Debut: The SU7

Xiaomi's highly anticipated SU7, its first electric car, made its grand debut. Details are still scarce, but the SU7 promises to be a "full-size high-performance eco-technology sedan," set to hit Chinese roads next year. Xiaomi's commitment to innovation extends to five core EV technologies, including E-Motor, CTB Integrated Battery, Xiaomi Die Casting, Xiaomi Pilot Autonomous Driving, and Smart Cabin.

Samsung's Galaxy Ring: A Smart Ring for Health and Sleep

Samsung unveils its Galaxy Ring, a groundbreaking wearable that monitors heart rate, movement, and breathing patterns, providing a comprehensive analysis of your health and sleep patterns. While pricing and battery life details remain under wraps, the Galaxy Ring promises to revolutionize sleep tracking.

OnePlus' Extended Battery Life: A Game-Changer for Smartwatches

OnePlus unveils its upcoming Watch 2, boasting an astounding 100 hours of battery life in "full Smart Mode." This remarkable achievement is the result of three years of meticulous battery technology development. OnePlus Europe's head of strategy, Tuomas Lampén, sheds light on the company's journey to achieving this milestone.

Xiaomi's CyberDog 2: The Evolved Robotic Companion

After years of anticipation, Xiaomi's CyberDog 2 made its MWC debut, captivating audiences with its agility and charm. Brian Heater, a TechCrunch reporter, witnessed the robotic dog's impressive dance moves and noted its resemblance to Boston Dynamics' familiar robot. Priced at $3,000, CyberDog 2 offers a more realistic head design and enhanced capabilities.

Lenovo's Transparent Laptop Concept: A Glimpse into the Future of Computing

Lenovo's transparent laptop concept stole the show, blurring the lines between reality and the digital world. This futuristic device features a transparent screen and keyboard, creating an augmented reality experience where graphics seamlessly blend with the environment. While still a concept, it showcases Lenovo's boundless creativity and vision for the future of computing.

Google's AI-Powered Innovations: Enhancing User Experience

Google unleashes a wave of AI-driven features across its services, including phones, cars, and wearables. Gemini, Google's AI assistant, takes center stage, crafting messages, generating image captions, summarizing texts, and providing easy access to passes on Wear OS. Additionally, Lookout, an app designed to assist visually impaired individuals, gains the ability to generate AI-powered captions for images with missing or inaccurate captions.

Infinix's E-Color Shift: A Colorful Twist on E-ink Displays

Infinix introduces the E-Color Shift, a vibrant upgrade to the e-ink screen technology pioneered by YotaPhone. This innovation brings color and a playful aesthetic to the often-overlooked back of your phone, transforming it into a canvas for self-expression.

Seaborough's Mood-Boosting Desktop Lamp: A Ray of Positivity

Seaborough, a Dutch company, unveils its innovative desktop lamp designed to mimic the sun's impact on serotonin production in the brain. This compact device, powered by USB, aims to improve mood and well-being by replicating the sun's natural effects.

Conclusion

Mobile World Congress 2024 has been a whirlwind of innovation, showcasing the latest advancements in technology. From AI-powered devices to futuristic concepts, the event has provided a glimpse into the future of tech. Stay tuned as we continue to bring you the most exciting news and insights from the world of mobile technology.

Title: Spain's Embat, which has raised $16M, plans to compete with Trovata in real-time accounting
Text:
Unlocking Real-Time Treasury Management with Embat

In the realm of finance, time is of the essence. Embat, a Spanish fintech, is revolutionizing the way businesses manage their finances by introducing real-time treasury management.

The Power of Automation

Embat's platform automates accounting and bank reconciliation, freeing up finance teams to focus on strategic initiatives. By centralizing collections, payments, and treasury processes, Embat streamlines operations, saving businesses valuable time and resources.

Industry Recognition

Embat's innovative approach has garnered significant attention in the financial sector. The company has secured a $16 million Series A funding round led by Creandum, with participation from renowned investors, including former Deutsche Bank and Commerzbank executives.

A Growing Client Base

With over 150 corporate clients across Europe, including Playtomic, Cabify, Wallapop, and Fever, Embat has established itself as a trusted partner for businesses seeking to optimize their financial operations.

AI and Innovation

Embat is constantly pushing the boundaries of innovation. The company has partnered with Google Cloud's Vertex AI platform to reduce errors in accounting teams. By leveraging AI, Embat aims to further enhance the accuracy and efficiency of its platform.

A Competitive Landscape

Embat faces competition from established players like Kyriba and Sage XRT. However, the company's focus on APIs and automated cash accounting sets it apart. This approach enables clients to connect globally and save significant costs.

Looking Ahead

Embat's future is bright. With a growing client base and a commitment to innovation, the company is poised to become a leading provider of real-time treasury management solutions. By empowering finance teams to make informed decisions in real-time, Embat is transforming the way businesses manage their finances.

Title: Writer's latest models can generate text from images, including charts and graphs
Text:
Unlocking the Power of Images: Writer's Palmyra-Vision Revolutionizes Text Generation

In the realm of generative AI, Writer stands out with its mission to harness the potential of multimodal content for enterprises. Their latest innovation, Palmyra-Vision, empowers users to effortlessly transform images, including charts and graphs, into comprehensive text descriptions.

"We're doubling down on multimodal input and text output," explains May Habib, Writer's co-founder and CEO. "Palmyra-Vision allows us to unlock valuable insights from visual data."

Instead of generating images, Palmyra-Vision focuses on analyzing them. Its sophisticated multi-model approach assigns specific tasks to each model, ensuring unparalleled accuracy in text generation.

Endless Use Cases for Text from Images

Palmyra-Vision opens up a world of possibilities:

 E-commerce Automation: Generate product descriptions for dynamic e-commerce websites, eliminating the need for manual updates.
 Chart and Graph Interpretation: Extract key insights from complex visualizations, providing automated analysis and understanding.
 Compliance Checking: Ensure adherence to regulatory guidelines by automatically comparing ad copy against compliance documents.

Handwritten Note Interpretation

Palmyra-Vision can even interpret and summarize handwritten notes. However, Habib emphasizes the importance of training the model for specific use cases, such as medical or insurance, to ensure accuracy.

Human Review: Essential for Quality Control

Habib stresses the need for human review alongside these tools. "Models can sometimes make up information or get facts wrong," she says. "Human oversight is crucial to ensure reliability."

Writer is actively working towards automating this review process to streamline workflows and maintain consistency across customers.

Investment and Partnerships

Writer has raised $126 million to date and is in talks with major cloud infrastructure platforms for potential partnerships. Their latest funding round, a $100 million Series B, was led by Iconiq last year.

Availability

Palmyra-Vision with image-to-text capabilities is now available for use.

Title: Text-to-speech app Speechify launches Gmail integration and voice cloning
Text:
Speechify: The Ultimate Text-to-Speech App Gets a Major Upgrade

Get ready for a text-to-speech revolution! Speechify, the popular iOS app, has just unveiled a game-changing update (v3.0) that will transform your reading experience.

A Home Page That's All About You

The redesigned home page puts you in control. Import files with ease from a range of sources, including iOS Files, Google Drive, Gmail, and more. The new scan feature lets you capture physical documents and instantly listen to their contents. Plus, set your daily reading goal with the Apple Fitness Ring-inspired progress tracker.

Unlock the Power of Gmail and Canvas

Say goodbye to email clutter! Speechify now integrates with Gmail, allowing you to read your emails and listen to PDF attachments. Students rejoice! Canvas integration gives you seamless access to homework assignments. And with iCloud integration, your files are always at your fingertips.

Widgets and Offline Listening

iOS 17's interactive widgets are now part of the Speechify experience. Import sources, track your progress, and continue listening to documents with ease. Premium voices are now available offline, so you can enjoy your favorite narrations even when you're on the go.

AI-Powered Features

Speechify's AI voice models have received a major upgrade, delivering more natural and expressive narration. Clone your own voice and have it read aloud your texts. Get AI-generated summaries of documents and articles, complete with audio playback.

Explore a World of Content

Discover a curated collection of engaging content on Speechify's redesigned explore page. Topics range from productivity to self-improvement and learning differences, presented in an Instagram Stories-like format.

A One-Stop Reading Destination

Speechify aims to be the ultimate reading companion. With integrations for external sources, in-app browsing, and a separate audiobook vertical, it offers a comprehensive reading experience.

The Future of Text-to-Speech

Speechify's mission is to make reading accessible and enjoyable for everyone. With its latest update, the app takes a major step forward, offering a seamless, personalized, and AI-powered reading experience.

Title: Volunteer at TechCrunch Early Stage in Boston
Text:
Calling all event enthusiasts!

TechCrunch Early Stage, our founder-focused summit, is returning to Boston on April 25th, and we're seeking passionate volunteers to join our team and make this event a success.

If you're curious about the inner workings of tech events, this is your chance to get a behind-the-scenes look and contribute to an unforgettable experience. As a volunteer, you'll witness firsthand how these events are meticulously crafted and executed.

But that's not all! Once your shift is complete, you'll earn a ticket to enjoy Early Stage 2024 and delve into the world of startups. Plus, you'll receive a free pass to Disrupt, our flagship event taking place in San Francisco from October 28th to 30th.

Whether you aspire to be a startup founder, marketer, or event coordinator, this is an exceptional opportunity to learn from industry experts and gain hands-on experience in producing a world-renowned startup event.

During the event, you'll have the chance to attend expert-led workshops covering crucial topics like accelerating user growth, securing funding, and building a strong brand. These sessions will provide valuable insights and actionable strategies for anyone looking to navigate the startup landscape.

With an expected turnout of 1,500 attendees, volunteers will play a vital role in ensuring a seamless and enriching experience for everyone. You might find yourself assisting with registration, guiding speakers, directing attendees, scanning tickets, or contributing to the overall event setup.

Join us as a volunteer and embark on an enriching journey that combines valuable event experience with the opportunity to immerse yourself in the vibrant startup ecosystem.

Volunteer spots are limited, so don't miss out on this unique opportunity. Apply before April 8th to be considered and become part of the team that brings TechCrunch Early Stage to life!

Title: Lapse, the app turning your phone into an old-school camera, snaps up $30M
Text:
In a world saturated with digital photography, a yearning for the simplicity and charm of analogue cameras has sparked a revival. Lapse, a pioneering startup, has captured the essence of this longing by introducing a smartphone app that emulates the analogue experience.

With Lapse, users can take pictures that they must wait to see "developed," just like in the old days. There's no chance for editing or retaking, adding an element of anticipation and excitement to the process. Once developed, users can share their photos with a select group of friends, creating a more intimate and meaningful sharing experience.

Lapse has gained significant traction, boasting millions of users, 100 million photos captured monthly, and a consistent top-10 ranking in the U.S. app store for photographic apps. This success has attracted a new round of funding worth $30 million, led by Greylock and DST Global Partners, with participation from previous backers.

The company plans to use this funding to enhance the photo experience, introduce video capabilities, and explore monetization strategies that steer clear of intrusive advertising. Lapse's ethos centers around authenticity and simplicity, aiming to provide a refreshing alternative to the heavily edited and curated content that dominates social media platforms.

The app's mechanics are a blend of nostalgia and innovation. It employs computer vision and proprietary technology to optimize the composition and appearance of photos, ensuring visually appealing results. However, Lapse has faced criticism for its initial growth tactics, which involved forced invites and aggressive marketing.

Despite these concerns, Lapse remains committed to providing a genuine and user-friendly experience. It has moved away from forced invites and is finding organic growth through its journaling features and word-of-mouth recommendations.

Lapse's emergence reflects a growing desire for simpler and more authentic social media experiences. As consumers become increasingly wary of data privacy and the overwhelming nature of mainstream platforms, Lapse offers a refreshing alternative that focuses on meaningful connections and unfiltered moments.

Investors see potential in Lapse's unique approach. Jacob Andreou, a general partner at Greylock, believes that Lapse fills a void in the social media landscape by providing a dedicated space for users to connect with friends and share their lives without the distractions of news, entertainment, or influencer culture.

Lapse's journey is a testament to the enduring appeal of simplicity and authenticity in the digital age. As the company continues to evolve and refine its platform, it has the potential to reshape the way we share and connect with others through photography.

Title: The Future Of Data Storytelling Is Augmented, Not Automated
Text:
Title: The Art of Data Storytelling: A Harmonious Blend of Human and AI Capabilities

In today's data-driven world, storytelling has emerged as a powerful tool for businesses to communicate complex information, inspire action, and drive positive change. However, the sheer volume and complexity of data can make it challenging to extract meaningful insights and present them in a compelling manner. This is where the integration of artificial intelligence (AI) and human expertise comes into play, creating a dynamic partnership that elevates the art of data storytelling.

The Essence of Data Storytelling: A Tapestry of Art and Science

Data storytelling is an intricate blend of art and science, requiring a unique combination of skills and knowledge. On the artistic side, it involves understanding business acumen, audience empathy, narrative formation, visual design, and messaging. On the scientific side, it benefits from analysis, psychology, and behavioral economics. This delicate balance makes data storytelling difficult to master and even more challenging to automate.

The Role of AI: A Scientific Ally in the Storytelling Journey

AI excels in the scientific aspects of data storytelling, particularly in handling technical and structured tasks. Its strength lies in processing vast amounts of data, identifying patterns, and generating insights that might escape human attention. AI can assist in data cleansing, preparation, analysis, and visualization, freeing up humans to focus on the creative and strategic aspects of storytelling.

The Human Edge: The Art of Crafting Compelling Narratives

Humans possess distinct advantages in the artistic aspects of data storytelling. Our creativity, imagination, and emotional intelligence allow us to explore the data creatively, identify compelling narratives, and communicate key findings in engaging ways. We can adapt stories to the needs and interests of specific audiences, adjusting in real-time as they react. This human touch adds depth and authenticity to data stories, making them more persuasive and memorable.

The Path Forward: Augmentation, Not Automation

Rather than seeking to fully automate data storytelling, we should embrace the concept of augmentation. By combining the strengths of AI and human capabilities, we can create a powerful partnership that enhances the quality and impact of data stories. AI can augment human efforts by providing deeper insights, automating repetitive tasks, and generating alternative perspectives. Humans, in turn, can leverage AI's assistance to refine their storytelling approach, explore new possibilities, and create more impactful narratives.

Benefits of Human-AI Collaboration in Data Storytelling

The collaboration between humans and AI in data storytelling offers numerous benefits:

- Enhanced Efficiency: AI can handle data-intensive tasks, allowing humans to focus on higher-value activities such as strategy development and creative storytelling.

- Improved Accuracy and Consistency: AI's analytical capabilities can help identify errors and inconsistencies in data, ensuring the accuracy and reliability of insights.

- Broader Perspectives: By combining human intuition with AI's data-driven insights, organizations can gain a more comprehensive understanding of complex issues and make better decisions.

- Increased Creativity and Innovation: The interplay between human creativity and AI's ability to generate unexpected connections can lead to novel storytelling approaches and innovative solutions.

- Deeper Audience Engagement: Human storytellers can leverage AI's insights to tailor stories to specific audiences, creating a more personalized and engaging experience.

Conclusion: A Harmonious Partnership for Data Storytelling Excellence

Data storytelling is a powerful tool that, when combined with the capabilities of AI, can unlock a wealth of insights and drive meaningful change. However, it is essential to recognize the unique contributions of both humans and AI in this process. By embracing augmentation rather than automation, organizations can create a harmonious partnership that elevates the art of data storytelling, resulting in compelling narratives that inform, inspire, and transform.

Title: Driverless Trucking At CES 2024: Product Deployment On The Horizon
Text:
CES 2024: A Glimpse into the Future of Autonomous Driving

The Consumer Electronics Show (CES) 2024 was a hub of innovation and excitement, with autonomous driving technology taking center stage. While the hype surrounding self-driving cars has simmered down, key players in the industry showcased their advancements and discussed the path to profitability.

Redundancy and Readiness Take Center Stage

A key theme at CES was the emphasis on redundancy and fail-safe systems for autonomous vehicles. Companies like Kodiak, Gatik, and Aurora highlighted their efforts to ensure safety and reliability in driverless operations. Redundant components, isolated fallback systems, and comprehensive sensing suites were among the strategies discussed.

Scaling Up for Profitability

The focus has shifted from developing the technology to scaling it up for commercial success. Aurora's partnership with Continental, a Tier 1 automotive supplier, is a significant step in this direction. Continental will produce Aurora's ADS system at scale, reducing cash pressure and enabling Aurora to focus on revenue generation.

Autonomous Trucking Leads the Way

Autonomous trucking is seen as a low-hanging fruit in the autonomous driving space. Companies like Gatik, Kodiak, and Aurora are preparing to launch driverless trucking operations in the near future. Gatik's "Freight-Only" services and Kodiak's plans to initiate driverless operations between Dallas and Houston are examples of this progress.

Ag Autonomy: A Growing Market

Agricultural autonomy is another area witnessing significant growth. Companies like Deere & Company are integrating autonomy into various types of farm equipment, from tractors to earthmovers. The focus is on improving productivity, precision, and safety while addressing the driver shortage.

Aurora's Steady Progress

Aurora, a leading player in autonomous driving, announced a significant milestone at CES. They have achieved an Autonomous Readiness Measure (ARM) of 93%, indicating their technology's readiness for commercial launch. Aurora's partnership with PACCAR and Volvo Trucks for truck integration and its focus on Transportation as a Service (TaaS) position the company for long-term success.

The Road Ahead

While full validation of autonomous trucking's safety performance is yet to be achieved, the industry is moving towards scale-ability and profitability. Companies are focusing on real-world deployments, partnerships, and revenue generation. CES 2024 provided a glimpse into this exciting future, where autonomous driving technology is poised to transform transportation.

Title: What We Can Learn From Renewcell’s Financial Struggles
Text:
The Intriguing Case of Renewcell: A Tale of Innovation, Challenges, and the Future of Textile Recycling

In the realm of sustainability, Renewcell emerged as a beacon of hope, pioneering textile-to-textile recycling technology. However, their recent bankruptcy filing raised questions about the viability of their approach. While their advanced recycling process is technically sound, the path to profitability remains elusive.

The crux of the issue lies in the specific waste requirements of Renewcell's technology. It demands a highly homogenous waste input, best met by post-industrial waste from manufacturing countries. However, the fashion industry's focus on post-consumer waste, particularly in the Global North, creates a mismatch between the technology's needs and the available feedstock.

The absence of a business case for Renewcell's recycled fibers in the competitive textile supply chain further complicates matters. Brands, typically removed from the intricacies of fiber sourcing, rely on garment manufacturers to handle costings and economies of scale. In a volatile market, committing to more expensive, albeit environmentally friendly, materials becomes a challenging proposition.

The solution may lie in integrating advanced recycling technologies into the existing textile supply chain in Asia, where the majority of textiles are produced. This would allow for end-to-end infrastructure and operational data to evaluate the business case without relying solely on sustainability narratives.

India, with its established mechanical textile recycling supply chain and rapidly expanding middle class, presents a promising opportunity for textile circularity. The Re-START Alliance, along with recent waste analysis initiatives, signals a growing commitment to a viable circular textiles economy in the region.

The future of textile-to-textile recycling hinges on aligning technological innovation with the realities of the global textile supply chain. By integrating these technologies into the heart of manufacturing hubs like Asia, we can unlock the potential for a truly circular and sustainable fashion industry.

Title: Yes, You Can Donate Blood After Receiving a Covid-19 Vaccine
Text:
Busting the Myth: Covid-19 Vaccines and Blood Donation

In the midst of the ongoing Covid-19 pandemic, ensuring a steady supply of blood donations is crucial. However, recent rumors have surfaced, claiming that the American Red Cross prohibits blood donation after receiving a Covid-19 vaccine. This misinformation poses a significant threat to the nation's blood supply, which is already facing a critical shortage.

The truth is, the American Red Cross explicitly allows blood donation after Covid-19 vaccination, except in rare circumstances. The organization's eligibility criteria state that individuals who have received non-replicating, inactivated, or RNA-based Covid-19 vaccines, such as Pfizer-BioNTech, Moderna, Novavax, or AstraZeneca, can donate blood immediately, provided they are symptom-free and fever-free.

The temporary deferral of blood donation for two weeks applies only to individuals who have received live attenuated Covid-19 vaccines. These vaccines contain a weakened form of the virus, which may pose a potential risk to immunocompromised recipients. However, live attenuated Covid-19 vaccines are not widely available in the United States, and the vast majority of Americans have received non-replicating vaccines.

The American Red Cross's cautious approach is intended to ensure the safety of both donors and recipients. By asking about live attenuated vaccines, the organization aims to minimize the risk of transmitting any potential viruses through blood transfusions.

It's important to note that this deferral period is temporary. After two weeks, individuals who have received live attenuated Covid-19 vaccines can also donate blood without any restrictions.

The Red Cross emphasizes that blood donation is a safe and essential act of kindness, especially during this time of crisis. With the majority of Americans vaccinated against Covid-19, there's no need to worry about vaccine-related restrictions on blood donation.

If you're healthy and eligible, consider donating blood to help those in need. Your contribution can save lives and make a real difference in the fight against Covid-19 and other medical emergencies.

Title: How Does AI Classify? Top Insights On How We Train Models
Text:
The Puzzling World of AI Measurement

In the realm of artificial intelligence (AI), we often grapple with the question of how to accurately measure its capabilities. Last week, MIT's Dylan Hadfield-Menell shed light on this complex issue, challenging our assumptions about the objectivity of data and the limits of classification.

Data: A Subjective Lens

Hadfield-Menell began by highlighting the fundamental idea that data is not an objective reflection of the world but rather a subjective representation. This concept becomes particularly relevant in the context of AI, where we rely on data to train and evaluate models.

The Enigma of Computer Vision

Using computer vision as an example, Hadfield-Menell posed a seemingly straightforward question: "Is a picture a picture of a cat?" While we might assume a clear-cut answer, he introduced the concept of "adversarial examples" – imperceptible changes to an image that can fool machine learning classifiers. This raises the question of whether the classifier's misclassification is truly an error or a reflection of the subjective nature of the data.

The Role of Programming

Hadfield-Menell emphasized that the data used to train AI systems is more akin to a program than a reflection of reality. By selecting specific data, we essentially encode our subjective desires into the system. This becomes evident in the case of ChatGPT, where different expectations and evaluations can lead to perceptions of "laziness" or improvement.

The Path Forward: Defining Success

Hadfield-Menell stressed the importance of defining clear criteria for evaluating AI models. This requires developers to articulate the goals of the system and the principles by which its success will be measured. By understanding the subjective choices made in the design process, we can better interpret and utilize AI's capabilities.

Conclusion

The measurement of AI remains a complex and evolving field. By embracing the subjective nature of data and the role of programming in shaping AI's behavior, we can navigate the challenges of evaluating and deploying these powerful technologies. The ability to explain the targeting and nature of AI models will be crucial for unlocking the full potential of AI in our society.

Title: Mastering Service Intelligence 2.0
Text:
Unlocking Service Excellence: How Service Intelligence 2.0 Revolutionizes Issue Resolution

In the dynamic world of customer service, resolving issues swiftly and effectively is the key to maintaining customer satisfaction. Service Intelligence 2.0, guided by the principles of Master Data Management (MDM), emerges as a transformative approach to enhance issue resolution efficiency, empowering service agents with actionable insights and driving organizational success.

Consolidation: Unifying Knowledge from Diverse Sources

Service Intelligence 2.0 consolidates information from various platforms and sources, such as Salesforce, ServiceNow, Jira, knowledge base articles, and product manuals, into a unified platform. This eliminates the challenge of searching through multiple platforms for relevant insights, enabling service agents to access all the necessary information at their fingertips.

Cleansing: Standardizing and Simplifying Data

The data consolidated from various sources often comes in different formats and with varying degrees of reliability. Service Intelligence 2.0 employs custom large language models and reference data checks to standardize and cleanse the data, making it easier to interpret and analyze. This process helps identify similar or divergent resolution paths across data sources, facilitating the capture of new insights and informing intervention strategies.

Governance: Ensuring Accuracy and Alignment with Organizational Goals

Service Intelligence 2.0 goes beyond data consolidation and cleansing. It also involves governance to ensure that the insights derived are accurate, unbiased, and aligned with the organization's objectives. Subject matter experts play a crucial role in this process, verifying the acquired knowledge, recommending additional steps and tests, and identifying any discrepancies between field practices and established recommendations.

Sharing: Democratizing Data for Informed Decision-Making

Once a unified repository of intelligent systems is established, Service Intelligence 2.0 democratizes data previously dispersed across various silos. This allows organizations to disseminate the repository or grant access to it through a centralized platform, enabling technicians to leverage shared data and its impact on service key performance indicators (KPIs).

Conclusion: The Ongoing Journey to Service Excellence

Service Intelligence 2.0 is a continuous journey, with manuals, knowledge articles, and new cases evolving constantly. The processes of consolidation, cleansing, governance, and sharing are ongoing efforts, ensuring that service agents have access to the most up-to-date and accurate information to resolve issues efficiently. By mastering MDM principles, organizations can harness the power of Service Intelligence 2.0 to drive informed decision-making, foster collaboration, and deliver unparalleled service excellence in today's competitive landscape.

Title: Hot girl summer who? It's Barbie flip phone summer now
Text:
Title: Barbie's Back with a Retro Flip Phone: Unleashing Nostalgia and Simplicity

In the wake of the Barbie movie's box office triumph, Mattel is poised to unleash another surprise hit with the Barbie flip phone, set to launch in summer 2024. Partnering with European smartphone manufacturer Human Mobile Devices (HMD), this revival aims to capture the essence of the iconic doll while offering a refreshing take on digital detox.

Unlike contemporary flip phones boasting advanced features, the Barbie flip phone embraces simplicity, harking back to the phone's original purpose: performing basic functions without distractions. This move aligns with the growing demand for digital detox, particularly among Gen Z, who seek a reprieve from the constant bombardment of notifications and social media feeds.

The phone's design exudes vintage charm, embodying the "girl empowerment brand" with a dash of pink and sparkle. It caters to the Gen Z movement embracing flip phones, who find solace in the traditional device that allows them to be present and enjoy moments without distractions.

As a Gen Z myself, I can envision my friends and I embracing the 90s nostalgia, stepping out with our pocketable pink flip phones, enjoying quality time without the burden of smartphones. Flip phones facilitate genuine connections and wholesome experiences, encouraging us to savor moments with friends, free from the distractions that modern smartphones bring.

While the Barbie flip phone holds immense appeal for weekend getaways and nights out, it's essential to acknowledge that smartphones remain indispensable for everyday life. The need to stay connected for work, social media, and news updates necessitates a primary smartphone.

The success of the Barbie flip phone hinges on its affordability. To justify purchasing a second phone, the price point must be attractive enough for those seeking a digital detox on weekends or during specific events. Many flip phone users opt for them as secondary devices due to their low cost, often around $20.

The allure of an unplugged, distraction-free summer with the Barbie flip phone is undeniable, but the ultimate decision to purchase will depend on the price, which is yet to be revealed.

Title: How you (and Elon Musk) can set up Windows 11 without a Microsoft account
Text:
In the realm of technology, even the most renowned figures can encounter difficulties. Such was the case for tech billionaire Elon Musk, who recently faced an unexpected hurdle while attempting to set up his new Windows 11 laptop.

Musk's primary concern stemmed from the requirement to create a Microsoft account during the installation process. This stipulation raised his apprehension due to the potential access it would grant Microsoft's AI program, Copilot, to his personal computer. Musk expressed his discontent on social media, highlighting his discomfort with the mandatory inclusion of Copilot in Windows 11.

Musk's predicament sparked a broader discussion among Windows users, many of whom shared similar reservations about the intrusive nature of Copilot. Previously an optional feature, Copilot became an integral part of Windows 11 with the release of version 22H2. While users can temporarily disable Copilot through the Settings menu, it remains embedded within the system.

To achieve a permanent solution, users must delve into the intricacies of the Group Policy or Registry Editor. This process, however, is not without its challenges and carries the risk of unintended consequences for those unfamiliar with such modifications.

Musk, in his characteristically direct manner, opted for a more straightforward approach. He reached out to Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella via text message, seeking assistance with the matter. Alternatively, he could have consulted Windows expert Ed Bott, who had previously addressed the issue in his articles.

Bott's workaround involves utilizing a dummy Microsoft account with a fabricated password. This approach allows users to bypass the mandatory account creation and establish a local account instead. However, this method comes with a caveat: the system's drive will not be automatically encrypted.

Users are thus presented with a dilemma: the choice between having Copilot on their system with the added protection of encryption or opting for a local account and foregoing the AI program at the expense of drive encryption. Those who choose the latter option can manually encrypt their drive using BitLocker or a third-party encryption program.

For those already using Windows 11 with a Microsoft account and seeking to revert to a local account, the process involves navigating through the Settings menu and following the prompts.

For individuals harboring deep-rooted distrust towards Windows and Microsoft AI, a viable alternative exists: Desktop Linux. Musk's own companies, including SpaceX and Tesla, rely heavily on Linux, making it a familiar and potentially appealing option for his personal computing needs.

It is worth noting, however, that Linus Torvalds, the creator of Linux, is known for his aversion to end-user tech support inquiries. Therefore, Musk should proceed with caution if he intends to seek direct assistance from Torvalds.

Title: Dock Health Achieves HITRUST Essentials, 1-year (e1) Certification Demonstrating Foundational Cybersecurity
Text:
In a world where healthcare experiences a constant battle against cyber threats, Dock Health emerges as a beacon of security, earning the prestigious HITRUST Essentials, 1-year (e1) Certification. This accolade signifies Dock Health's unwavering commitment to cybersecurity and information risk management, setting a new benchmark for healthcare collaboration and workflow automation.

Dock's work management and automation platform has proven its dedication to implementing essential cybersecurity controls, demonstrating a robust foundation of protection against evolving threats. The HITRUST CSF serves as the guiding framework, prescribing adaptive controls that align with the platform's assurance type.

"Patient privacy is paramount in healthcare," emphasizes Michael Docktor, M.D., CEO and co-founder of Dock Health. "Our users rely on us to provide secure experiences that stay ahead of emerging threats. The HITRUST e1 Certification is a testament to our dedication to cybersecurity and data protection."

Dock Health's comprehensive workforce management solution empowers healthcare teams to optimize workflows, boost employee engagement, enhance efficiency, and mitigate staffing shortages. Its secure platform enables real-time collaboration, capturing and automating operational and administrative tasks that form the backbone of clinical care delivery.

Nitin Gujral, CTO and co-founder of Dock Health, highlights the importance of trustworthy systems in healthcare. "Our customers entrust us with the secure handling of sensitive information, and we take that responsibility seriously. Dock provides an unparalleled level of security, ensuring that healthcare organizations can drive efficiency, operational excellence, and sustainability for generations to come."

Jeremy Huval, Chief Innovation Officer at HITRUST, commends Dock Health's achievement. "The e1 Validated Assessment is ideal for organizations like Dock Health that prioritize information security and privacy. It serves as a solid foundation for maturing risk management and compliance programs."

Robert Booker, Chief Strategy Officer at HITRUST, applauds Dock Health's commitment to cybersecurity. "Dock Health's successful completion of the HITRUST e1 Certification demonstrates their dedication to protecting sensitive data and building trust among stakeholders."

Dock Health stands as a beacon of security in the healthcare landscape, empowering organizations to deliver exceptional patient care while safeguarding sensitive information. Its HITRUST e1 Certification serves as a testament to its unwavering commitment to cybersecurity and information risk management.
